description: ERECTION OF SINGLE STOREY EXTENSION TO GARAGE
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The developments to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 5 years, beginning with the date of this permission.  Reason for condition: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

Condition : 2 - The facing materials to be used for the external surfaces of the extension hereby approved shall be those specified in the planning application form (received dated 9/4/98) unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason for condition: To ensure a satisfactory appearance of the development.

Condition : 3 - Details/particulars of the insulation of the building against the transmission of noise and vibration shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development starts. The insulation works shall be carried out in accordance with the details approved and shall be in place prior to the commencement of the use hereby approved.  Reason for condition: To protect the amenities of neighbouring residential occupiers.

Condition : 4 - The new extension hereby permitted shall not be used/ occupied at any time other than for purposes ancillary to the existing authorised garage use of the main property known as 290 Haydons Road London SW19.  Reason for condition: To ensure that the property is not sub-divided without planning permission being attained from the Local Planning Authority, in order to protect the amenities of the area and residential amenity.
